meanings.definition: A backward flow of a liquid or gas
meanings.sent1: The reflux of water in the pipe caused a mess in the kitchen.
meanings.sent2: The reflux of lava from the volcano was dangerous.
meanings.sent3: The reflux of soda in the bottle made it fizz uncontrollably.
meanings.sent4: The reflux of emotions overwhelmed her like a tidal wave.
meanings.sent5: The reflux of oil in the engine damaged the machinery beyond repair.

meanings.sent1: After drinking too much water, it refluxed back up his throat.
meanings.sent2: The river water refluxed after the dam was opened.
meanings.sent3: His laughter refluxed loudly in the quiet library, causing heads to turn.
meanings.sent4: The memories refluxed in her mind like a never-ending loop.
meanings.sent5: The music refluxed in his ears, bringing back nostalgic feelings.

meanings.definition: The act of flowing back or returning
meanings.sent1: The reflux of the tide surprised the beachgoers.
meanings.sent2: The reflux of the crowd at the concert was chaotic.
meanings.sent3: The reflux of the joke in his mind made him burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: The reflux of thoughts kept her awake at night.
meanings.sent5: The reflux of traffic in the city caused delays for hours.
